result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael D. Edwards was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Michael D. Edwards is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Michael D. Edwards was found guilty of Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (<=1g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Second and Subsequent Offense, On or Near a Park], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1g.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If revoked, deft requests pre-sentence credit of approx 3 weeks.

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees. 
** Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges. Submit a DNA sample (unless previously provided).
** Pay DNA surcharges.  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  Coopeate with the Child Support Agency to pay child support and make all court appearances.  DOC shall promptly notify the court of any new arrest or criminal charge made against the deft.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

records.addlTxt: for Access to PSI (PSI sent via email to Atty Michelle Anderson with court's approval)
For Ct 1 only - Dismissed.
Conditions of Probation

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Patrick Cafferty.  Sentencing arguments.  Sentence w/held; placed on probation for 4yrs.  See conditions.  Appeal rights.  DNA ordered; notice given to deft.  Deft sentenced to 3mos KCJ as a condition of probation commencing 10/31/15 @ 6pm.  If revoked, deft requests pre-sentence credit of approx 3 weeks.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Patrick Cafferty.  Case is resolved.  Deft pleads guilty to count 2; found guilty by the Court.  Count 1 is dismissed on State's motion.  PSI ordered.  Sentencing set for 10/12/15 @ 1:30pm.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Patrick Cafferty.  Defense requests a short adjournment; will probably resolve.  Plea hrg set for 8/24/15 @ 1:15pm.  Deft taken into custody - outstanding warrant from Racine County.

MODIFIED.
*Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.
961.41(1)(cm)1r Manuf/Del Cocaine, Second & Subs Offense, On or Near a Park   /   961.41(1)(cm)1g Manuf/Deliver Cocaine, PTAC, Second & Subs Offense, On or Near a Park

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Atty Patrick Cafferty appeared on behalf of deft.  Deft not transported from the KCJ.  State has no objection to the deft's bond motion.  Court grants the deft's bond motion.  Deft's bond amended to $2500 signature with the same conditions.  Status conf set for 7/24/15 @ 11am.  Dates previously set for FPT/JS are removed from the court's calendar
Filed by Atty P Cafferty.
Atty  P Cafferty

for Bond Review
Scheduling Order

Attorney Tracey Braun appeared for the State. Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty. Patrick Cafferty. Clerk LE. Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 3. Information filed, plea of not guilty. Judicial pretrial on 6-3-15 @ 9:50am. Jury selection on 6-22-15 @ 9:00am.  Bond continued.
to Preliminary Hearing

Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 10 days; set before Commissioner on  5-12-15 @ 9:30 am.   Warrant vacated.   $2500.00 Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).
